text: None of the books in my fatherâ€™s dusty old bookcase were encourageddisappearedforbiddenoutdated forbidden . Yet while I was growing up, I never saw anyone take one down. Most were massive tomes-a comprehensive history of civilization, matching volumes of the great works of western literature, numerous others I can no longer recall-that seemed almost fused to boardplateshelvesfloorshelves that bowed slightly from decades of steadfastunstableinsecureessentialsteadfast  support.
